Fundamental and Combinatorial Structures and Associated Graph Algorithms
This section details the Fundamental and Combinatorial records, which are used for creating and manipulating structured data representations within GAP. It also covers functions for converting these structures into graphs and for computing their stabilizers and canonical forms.
Function documentation
<#Include Label="Fundamental" />
The Fundamental record provides the basic building blocks such as atoms, collections, and tuples. Building upon these, the Combinatorial record offers convenient constructors for common mathematical objects.
